column1: ID System: Loan Charge-Offs and Recoveries

column4: Definition
The total amount of charged-off loans and lease financing receivables debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Charge-offs:Loans Secured By Real Estate, Total
column4: The total amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

The total amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate (whose addresses are not within the U.S.) debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution. This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Real Estate Loans in Domestic Offices - charged-off
column4: The total amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate and held in domestic offices of the institution. RIS definitions:   YTD -IDDRREDM = SUM(DRRECONS, DRREAG, DRRERES, DRREMULT, DRRENRES)  QTR - IDDRREDQ = sum(drreconq,drreagq,drreresq,drremulq,drrenrsq)

column2: Charge-offs:Construction and Land Development Real Estate
column4: Total real estate loans (which are held in domestic offices) for construction and land development purposes that have charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: 1-4 Family Residential Construction Loan Charge offs
column4: Charged off 1-4 family residential construction loans. (Data available as of March 2007)

column2: Other Construction Loans and All Land Development and Other Land Loan Charge off
column4: Charged off other construction loans and all land development and other land loans. (Data available as of March 2007)

Total loans secured by farmland (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

column2: Charge-offs Secured By 1-4 Family Residential Properties
column4: Total loans secured by 1-4 family residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Charge offs:Secured By Multifamily Residential Properties
column4: Total multifamily (5 or more) residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.
Total nonfarm nonresidential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Secured By Owner-Occupied Nonfarm Nonresidential Properties - Charge offs
column4: Charged off loans secured by owner-occupied nonfarm nonresidential properties. Data available as of March 2007.This item was not available for TFR Reporters.

column2: Secured By Other Nonfarm Nonresidential Properties - Charge offs
column4: Charged off loans secured by other nonfarm nonresidential properties. Data available as of March 2007.This item was not available for TFR Reporters.

column2: Charge-offs:Real Estate Loans in Foreign Offices
column4: The total amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate and held in foreign offices of the institution.

Total loans to depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total loans to foreign depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Charge-offs:Loans To Finance Agricultural Production and Other Loans To Farmers
column4: Total loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total commercial and industrial loans that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  Note: For banks with assets of less than $300 million, this item includes all other loans (loans to depository institutions, agricultural loans, etc.).
Total loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Total credit cards and related plans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution. note: 1) prior to March 2001, included charge-offs of related revolving credit plans other than credit cards.
Charged-off loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures:  Automobile loans debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses. Quarterly variable: DRAUTOQ

Charged-off loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures: all other loans debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses.  Note: Prior to March  2011, excludes automobile loans.  Beginning March 2001, includes revolving creditplans other than credit cards. Quarterly Variable: DRCONOTQ

column2: Charge-offs:Loans To Foreign Governments and Official Institutions
column4: Total loans to foreign governments and official institutions that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

All other loans that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total lease financing receivables that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

column2: Charge-offs:Loans To Finance Agricultural and Other Loans To Farmers Bks <$300M
column4: Total loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is reported only by institutions with assets of $300 million or less.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.
The total amount of recoveries of loans and lease financing receivables credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Recoveries:Loans Secured By Real Estate, Total
column4: The total amount of recoveries of loans secured by real estate credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

The total amount of recoveries of loans secured by real estate (whose addresses are not within the U.S.) credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Recoveries:Real Estate Loans in Domestic Offices
column4: The total amount of recoveries of loans secured by real estate and held in domestic offices of the institution.RIS definition:YR - IDCRREDM = SUM(CRRECONS, CRREAG, CRRERES, CRREMULT, CRRENRES) QTR - IDCRREDQ = SUM(CRRECONQ, CRREAGQ, CRRERESQ, CRREMULQ, CRRENRSQ)

Total recoveries of real estate loans (which are held in domestic offices) for construction and land development purposes that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.
Recovered 1-4 family residential construction loans (data available as of March 2007)

column2: Recoveries:Other Construction Loans and All Land Development and Other Land Loan
column4: Recovered other construction loans and all land development and other land loans. (Data available as of March 2007)
Total recoveries of loans secured by farmland (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Total recoveries of loans secured by 1-4 family residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Total recoveries of multifamily (5 or more) residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.
Total recoveries of nonfarm nonresidential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Recoveries:Secured By Owner-Occupied Nonfarm Nonresidential Property
column4: Recovered loans secured by owner-occupied nonfarm nonresidential properties. Data available as of March 2007. This item was not available for TFR Reporters.

column2: Recoveries:Secured By Other Nonfarm Nonresidential Property
column4: Recovered loans secured by other nonfarm nonresidential properties. Data available as of March 2007. This item was not available for TFR Reporters.

column2: Recoveries:Real Estate Loans in Foreign Offices
column4: The total amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate and held in foreign offices of the institution.

Total recoveries of loans to depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total recoveries of loans to foreign depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Recoveries:Loans To Finance Agricultural Production and Other Loans To Farmers
column4: Total recoveries of loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total recoveries of commercial and industrial loans that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  Note: For banks with assets of less than $300 million, this item includes all other loans (loans to depository institutions, agricultural loans, etc.).
Total recoveries of loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Total recoveries of credit cards and related plans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution. note: 1) prior to March 2001, included recoveries of related revolving credit plans other than credit cards.
Recoveries of loans to Individuals for household, family and other personal expenditures:automobile loans credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses. Quarterly Variable: CRAUTOQ

Recoveries of loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures: all other loans credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses.  Note: Beginning March 2011, excludes automobile loans. Beginning March 2001, includes recoveries of revolving credit plans other than credit cards. Quarterly Variable: CRCONOTQ

column2: Recoveries:Loans To Foreign Governments and Official Institutions
column4: Total recoveries of loans to foreign governments and official institutions that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Recoveries of all other loans that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Total recoveries of lease financing receivables that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

column2: Recoveries:Loans To Finance Agricultural and Other Loans To Farmers Bks <$300M
column4: Total recoveries of loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been credited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is reported only by institutions with assets of $300 million or less.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

column2: Net Charge-offs: Total Loans and Leases
column4: Total loans and leases charged-off (removed from balance sheet because of uncollectibility), less amounts recovered on loans and leases previously charged-off.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans Secured By Real Estate, Total
column4: The net amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

The net amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate (whose addresses are not within the U.S.) debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Net Charge-Offs:Real Estate Loans in Domestic Offices
column4: The net amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate and held in domestic offices of the institution. RIS definition: YR - IDNTREDM = SUM(NTRECONS, NTREAG, NTRERES, NTREMULT, NTRENRES) QTR - IDNTREDQ = SUM(NTRECONQ,NTREAGQ,NTRERESQ,NTREMULQ,NTRENRSQ)

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans Construction and Land Development
column4: Net amount of real estate loans (which are held in domestic offices) for construction and land development purposes that have charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Net Charge offs:1-4 Family Residential Construction Loan
column4: Net charged off 1-4 family residential construction loans, debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses, held in domestic offices (data available as of March 2007)

column2: Net Charge offs:Other Contruction Loans and All Land Development and Other Land
column4: Net charged off other construction loans and all land development and other land loans, debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses, held in domestic offices. (Data available as of March 2007)

Net amount of loans secured by farmland (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters.TFR reports ended December 2011.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans Secured By 1-4 Family Residential Properties
column4: Net amount of loans secured by 1-4 family residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans Secured By Multifamily Residential Properties
column4: Net amount of multifamily (5 or more) residential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans Secured By Nonfarm Nonresidential Properties
column4: Net amount of nonfarm nonresidential properties (which are held in domestic offices) that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

column2: Net Charge offs-Secured By Owner-Occupied Nonfarm Nonresidential Properties
column4: Net charged off loans secured by owner-occupied nonfarm nonresidential properties, debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses, held in domestic offices (data available as of March 2007)

column2: Net Charge offs:Secured By Other Nonfarm Nonresidential Properties
column4: Net charged off loans secured by other nonfarm nonresidential properties, debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses, held in domestic offices. Data available as of March 2007. This item was not available for TFR Reporters.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Real Estate Loans in Foreign Offices
column4: The net amount of charged-off loans secured by real estate and held in foreign offices of the institution.

Net amount of loans to depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters.TFR reports ended December 2011.

Net amount of loans to foreign depository institutions and acceptances of other banks that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans To Finance Agricultural and Other Loans to Farmers
column4: Net amount of loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters.TFR reports ended December 2011.

Net amount of commercial and industrial loans that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  Note: For banks with assets of less than $300 million prior to 2001, this item includes all other loans (loans to depository institutions, agricultural loans, etc.).

Net amount of commercial and industrial loans with non-U.S. addressees that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This information is not available on a quarterly basis.

Net amount of loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Net amount of credit card loans to Individuals that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution. note: prior to 2001, included revolving credit plans other than credit cards.
Net charged-off loans to Individuals for household, family and other personal expenditures: automobile loans debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses. Quarterly Variable: NTAUTOQ
Net charged-off loans to Individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures:  All other loans debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses.Quarterly variable: NTCONOTQ

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans To Foreign Governments and Official Institutions
column4: Net amount of loans to foreign governments and official institutions that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.

Net amount of all other loans that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.

Net amount of lease financing receivables that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters.TFR reports ended December 2011.

column2: Net Charge-offs:Loans for Agricultural and Other Loans to Farmersbkslt300M
column4: Net amount of loans to finance agricultural production and other loans to farmers that have been charged-off and debited to the allowance for loan and lease losses established by the institution.  This item is reported only by institutions with assets of $300 million or less.  This item is not available for TFR Reporters. TFR Reports ended in December 2011.
